**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 249 4.0 You know a great deal about the natural world, and you command and train animals and magical beasts. Even if you’re untrained in Nature, you can use it to Recall Knowledge. Nature Untrained General Actions - [Recall Knowledge](/Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true) about fauna, flora, geography, weather, the environment, creatures of natural origin (like animals, beasts, fey, and plants), the First World, the Material Plane, and the Elemental Planes. Nature Trained General Actions - [Identify Magic](/Skills.aspx?ID=3&General=true), particularly primal magic. - [Learn a Spell](/Skills.aspx?ID=4&General=true) from the primal tradition. - [Tap Ley Line](/Skills.aspx?ID=7&General=true) tapping a primal ley line Commanded Animals Issuing commands to an animal doesn’t always go smoothly. An animal is an independent creature with limited intelligence. Most animals understand only the simplest instructions, so you might be able to instruct your animal to move to a certain square but not dictate a specific path to get there, or command it to attack a certain creature but not to make its attack nonlethal. The GM decides the specifics of the action your animal uses. The animal does what you commanded as soon as it can, usually as its first action on its next turn. If you successfully commanded it multiple times, it does what you said in order. It forgets all commands beyond what it can accomplish on its turn. If multiple people command the same animal, the GM determines how the animal reacts. The GM might also make the DC higher if someone has already tried to Command the Animal that round.
